comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Presuming that is the ORIZABA also alongside the Orient Wharf at east Circular Quay.  The ORIZABA and the ORIENT are difficult to tell apart at first glance, and I have made mistakes identifying them on PhM photos, partly because they changed appearance over the years - length of funnels, number of cross-spars, etc.  At this time (c.1885) the ORIENT had cross-spars on the second mast forward - the ORIZABA didn't.  And the ORIENT had a white streak half way down the sides, a wall with cabin portholes.  Confusing,  but when you look at them side by side in photos as good as these, it is more obvious - 

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/8725149344/]ORIENT
